definition: lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
flag/variant of 旗[qi2]
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: Our army won victory in the first battle.
sentences.chinese: 这个战役，我军旗开得胜。

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the National College Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 祝贺您今年高考旗开得胜，金榜题名。

sentences.english: Yeah you're right we're both totally striking out.
sentences.chinese: 耶，你是对的，我们旗开得胜了。

sentences.english: One time, I took on the whole class and won.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，我代表全班出战，并且旗开得胜。

sentences.english: "Well, " he said, "I had a great trip. "
sentences.chinese: “你知道吗？”他说，“我这一趟旗开得胜。”

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the national college entrance examination. I beg you to take this little gift as a souvenir.
sentences.chinese: 恭贺高考旗开得胜，奉上礼物以作纪念。

sentences.english: Ultimately, he says, his law will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 最后，他说道他的法案会旗开得胜的。

sentences.english: Hoover’s indecisiveness handed his successor a triumph at the very start of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 胡佛的优柔寡断让他的继任得以在履新伊始旗开得胜。

sentences.english: My degree enabled me to hit the ground running as soon as I graduated.
sentences.chinese: 我的学位让我一毕业就旗开得胜。

definition: to win instant success (idiom)
to congratulate beforehand/to offer best wishes for
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
to win/to be victorious/to report a victory
victory reports pour in (idiom); news of success in an endless stream
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
lit. plucking a branch of osmanthus from the Toad Palace (i.e. the moon)/fig. to succeed in the imperial examination
to triumph over an opponent
surname Zhu
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
to return in triumph/to return victorious
brimming with confidence (idiom)
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
to have a pleasant journey (idiom)
to have one's wishes come true/wish you the best!
report of success/report of a victory
